pros: This organization really is like a family that watches over and takes care of it's employees. I have never felt so taken care of and supported in a career or community.
cons: The new attendance policy isn't fair. It's not used across the board and it shouldn't be. I have been here for many years and before the attendance policy went into place, only hourly employees were held to a time punch standard. It shouldn't be used on salaried employees as when you are salary, you are paid for the job you do, not the time you keep. If you have good quality employees that are there everyday and work hard. If they are late sometimes and it's under 15 minutes, it shouldn't be held against them. Especially if others can walk in whenever they want.

The HR Department is the worst it’s ever been. You have a leader  who only cares about herself and doesn’t even value the Native culture. She is fake nice. Came from a Tire store, has no idea how to run an HR Department for a medical clinic.

job_title: Member Services Representative in Sacramento, CA
pros: Good location in downtown. Lots of good food around you but unfortunately you can’t afford because your job is crap
cons: You pay for parking. Terrible management Low pay Crap benefits Dirty place

pros: Local location Helpful coworkers Fast pace
cons: Mandatory 4 - 10 hour shifts Parking is far

job_title: Clinical Applications Coordinator I in Sacramento, CA
cons: If you get sick you’re penalized even if you have a doctors note.

job_title: Call Center Representative in Sacramento, CA
pros:
I felt the interview process was very streamlined and accommodating.

SNAHC was very prompt and flexible in responding, when asking them if it was ok to give my current temporary employer, my 2 week notice. Even though my background investigation was still pending. 

 The person that interviewed me, was very genuine and easy to speak to. I could not hear him when he was interviewing via Teams. So he stated he would call my cell phone instead, which alleviated the volume issue. That made me feel more at ease.
cons:
I thought my interview meeting was going to be through the Zoom app. And didn't know whether my interview should have been done through a cell phone or a desktop computer. 
I was caught off guard when I was told it would be through the Teams app. I thought I had that app on my cell phone, but turns out I didn't. That made me a little nervous and thought I had ruined my chances of getting hired. Luckily I was able to download the app and start the interview.

job_title: Licensed Clinical Social Worker LCSW in Sacramento, CA
pros: This organization has a lot of wonderful people who are committed to the vision of the organization. The atmosphere is collegial and collaborative. A second site is opening soon in South Sacramento. There are a lot of community events organized by SNAHC, and staff appreciation events are frequent.
cons: There have been key leadership positions that have been vacant, and onboarding was disorganized at the department level. The building itself is confusing, and parking is far from the building.

job_title: Medical Case Manager in Sacramento, CA
pros: Company recognition of long term employees
cons: The micro management was beyond ridiculous.

review_title: Poor Pay, Weak Leadership, Great Staff/Patients

cons: Pay, Benefits, No Cost of Living Increases, Cliques, Upper Management is disorganized, lots of nepotism
